Section 4:
Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants

Our final focus will be on discussing Section Four- Handling and Storage of Hazardous Materials and the Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants.

What are we dealing with?

Let's take a closer look at hazardous materials and the risks to children.

More than 70,000 chemicals are in use

The discovery and introduction of synthetic chemicals into our environment have grown tremendously.  Currently, more than 70,000 chemicals are in use.

Chemicals can harm the health of humans

Chemicals can harm the health of humans and animals.  Both synthetic and natural chemicals such as lead, once released into the environment, can be harmful.

2 million human poison exposures yearly

There are more than 2 million human poisonings reported to poison centers every year.

Children under six account for half of those potential poisonings

All children are at risk of poisoning but especially the younger children. Children under six years old account for half of those potential poisonings.
